function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Uncertainty about the impact of covid-19 on public space","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Global pandemic causing long-term impacts on planning and design of public spaces.","category":"Access to infrastructure  ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The need to integrate new ideas about public health into practice and leverage the crisis to build more just, healthier, and greener cities.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 may change public space design and use, affecting how people interact and move within public spaces.","category":"Access to infrastructure  ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changing preferences and expectations about green spaces due to the pandemic","category":"Cultural and Lifestyle Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"New expectations regarding social distancing within green spaces","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of green spaces during stay at home orders may result in overcrowding and difficulty maintaining social distancing.","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underused and neglected rooftop spaces may become overcrowded as people seek open air spaces for recreation and socialization.","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Permanent aversion to large public gatherings","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Social and class differences in the use of public space may lead to unequal exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Skilled workers can shift to online work, while lower income workers may not have this choice, leading to differential exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic and social divisions may be exacerbated by the shift to telecommuting, leading to unequal use of public spaces and segregation based on class, education level, or income.","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 challenges the traditional activities of public spaces, such as shopping and socializing, leading to potential changes in behavior and interactions in public areas.","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Clusters of people gathering in interior and exterior spaces","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Altered perception of capacity due to covid-19","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Interactive maps showing infected people’s locations may lead to stigmatization and discrimination.","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced attachment to public places due to prolonged absence during lockdown.","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in perceptions of public spaces correlated with covid-19 impact, lockdown severity, and economic impact.","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequities and exclusions in access to public spaces due to pandemic-related restrictions.","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exacerbation of existing inequalities and inequities due to covid-19 impact","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Religious minorities may face discrimination in public spaces due to associations between religion, class, and the spread of disease.","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Large influx of undocumented workers in the informal sector poses a risk to public health and social stability","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure of resilience strategies in response to large-scale events","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vague definition of resilience","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Overlap with existing concepts","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of disciplinary-specific approaches to resilience, including in the context of contagious diseases","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of organizational resilience may lead to decreased ability to absorb strain and adapt to adversity, increasing vulnerability to contagions.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of social resilience may result in a community’s inability to cope with external stresses and disturbances, making it more susceptible to contagion spread.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unequal distribution of resilience research across different domains may lead to neglect of certain areas of application, including contagious disease resilience.","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uneven distribution of resilience-related research across different years may indicate gaps in understanding the evolving nature of contagious disease threats and preparedness.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of domain-specific representation in quantitative resilience approaches may result in overlooking unique factors relevant to contagious disease propagation in different environments.","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient consideration of qualitative aspects in quantitative resilience approaches may lead to overlooking the socio-behavioral factors that influence contagious disease spread.","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on expert opinion for assessing resilience variables may introduce bias and inaccuracies in the assessment process.","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"General applicability of the resilience triangle metric may lead to misapplication in different contexts","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in comprehending the resilience metric","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unprecedented professional, social, and psychological challenges for nurses","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordination between nurses and doctors","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Purposive sampling technique used to select diverse participants may not fully represent the population and lead to biased results.","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Psychological problems among nursing staff","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear of infection leading to panic emotions, anxiety, and depression","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient nursing knowledge about the coronavirus","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate communication and collaboration may lead to confusion and errors in patient care.","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective communication and collaboration among healthcare professionals","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of support for isolated workers and those with chronic diseases","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological problems such as panic, fear, anxiety, and depression among staff nurses","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on the psychological well-being of nurses during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor communication and collaboration between nursing and medical management teams","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of communication and collaboration between nurses and physicians in a civil environment","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited scope of study with focus on nursing managers only","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
